string.text: External threads permit the installation of a silencer.
A mount allows you to install a scope.
Attachment point for an underslung grenade launcher.
Change standard magazines for larger ones.
The calibre of the weapon can be changed by modifying its internal mechanics.
The calibre of the weapon can be changed by modifying its internal mechanics.
The calibre of the weapon can be changed by modifying its internal mechanics.
The calibre of the weapon can be changed by modifying its internal mechanics.
Increased capacity of the internal magazine.
A polycarbonate ammo box increases ammo capacity.
An increased number of titanium plates greatly increases the strength of body armour.
Reinforcement plates give a much greater margin of survivability, compared to standard armour.
Aluminium / titanium plates have a lower weight while maintain the same defensive properties.
Titanium is usually too heavy for use in body armour, but its effective when used in conjunction with an exoskeleton.
Replacing metal elements with carbon fibre ones reduces the mass of body armour without loss of protection.
Kevlar is perhaps the most common material used in bullet-proof vests.
Polycarbonate plates can stop a pistol bullet, while weighing as little as a piece of ordinary plastic.
Ceramic plates are not durable, but provide superior protection to Kevlar.
Steel plates sewn into the jacket enhance its resistance to damage.
Ceramic coating can deflect a standard bullet, if it hits at an angle, or even completely stop it in case of a direct hit.
An additional, internal layer of plates protects the user, if the external one is damaged.
Special underarmour distributes bullet impact over the entire armour, reducing damage.
Even if the armour is severely damaged, the reinforced frame will stop pistol bullets.
Subtler armoured sheets that overlap each another, like scales, increase overall damage resistance.
A backup layer inside the armour increases survivability.
A set of knee and elbow pads, designed to protect joints from bullets and shrapnel.
Steel frame is replaced with one made from lightweight aluminium.
A self-repairing armour layer helps the armour to compensate for bullet impact.
An extra layer of silicone-cushioned ceramic plates.
Lighter synthetic and plastic parts replace standard ones, reducing the armour's mass.
An obscene amount of titanium plating would be too heavy for the average trooper, but not for one using a powered exoskeleton.
SBC-RHZ Mk II is a sealed combat jumpsuit, protecting from radiation and chemical agents.
Creating and weaving in a layer of chain mail is a time consuming, tedious job, but it can save your life.
The Scale system consists of tens of ceramic plates on top of each other, to provide excellent protection, even after receiving damage from bullets or shrapnel.
The Sovereign process affects the protective suit's fibre, reducing its susceptibility to damage, especially rupture.
Ceramic coating significantly reduces the impact of the bullet, splintering on contact.
A beryllium matrix reinforced with titanium (instead of aluminium) is one of the most reliable protective systems worldwide.
Ceramic coating significantly reduces the impact of the bullet, splintering on contact.
Carbon fibre is one of the most durable and wear resistant synthetic materials.
A combination of polymers and ceramics forms the basis for this multiple layer protection system.
Cutting edge protection technology - artificial sapphires integrated into key regions of the armour.
Perfectly fitted parts allow the weapon to last longer before jamming.
The once outlandish idea of substituting metal parts with polymer is now quite commonplace.
A low impulse hammer mechanism reduces recoil, without diminishing the weapon's reliability.
This modification adjusts the slide, so that it doesn't move while firing, providing excellent accuracy.
Often used in firearms, the roller locking system reduces recoil and increases accuracy in battle.
An auxiliary gas cylinder reduces the stress on the weapon's mechanism, significantly increasing the rate of fire.
A gas powered reloading mechanism turns semi-automatic shotguns into fully automatic beasts.
A layer of protective coating applied to each part reduces possibility of weapon failure.
This modification automatically seals the weapon when firing, acting in synch with the fire rate.
With an inertial reloading mechanism, a standard pump action shotgun can be turned into a semi-automatic.
A single, universal chamber closing mechanism is a modern technological solution reducing recoil.
An automated firing pin improves firearm accuracy.
An automatic counterforce mechanism moves away from the bolt, offsetting the recoil force.
A revamped firing mechanism increases the weapon's rate of fire.
When firing, this autonomous counterweight automatically changes its position, balancing the weapon and making it more comfortable to use.
A counterforce rotator installed in the receiver reduces weapon recoil.
The once outlandish idea of substituting metal parts with polymer is now quite commonplace.
This special mechanism reduces the weapon's sway, increasing accuracy.
A special mechanism that seals the barrel when firing, maximizing internal pressure.
Synchronised gears improve the trajectory of the bullet.
Installed on the back of the receiver, this modifications slows down the slide, increasing the weapon's accuracy.
Special slide parts compensate the movement of the slide, reducing recoil.
This complex modification is typically installed in dedicated sniper rifles, increasing its mass and reducing recoil.
A more convenient magazine loading mechanism, mobile parts allow for faster reloading.
Certain parts are replaced, increasing accuracy and, unfortunately, the failure rate.
A synthetic part installed behind the end of the step slide compresses it to increase accuracy.
A special compensator fixes the position of the barrel, automatically releasing gasses and pushing the barrel to its original position after firing.
This modification alters the trigger, making it break more smoothly. Useful for snipers.
improved slide mechanism to clearly predict the time of the shot, which positively affects accuracy.
Often used in Western arms, the roller locking system helps reduce recoil and increase accuracy.
This special mechanism compensates recoil, making sustained fire easier.
A three-position gas regulator reduces difficulties in handling the rifle, making it less capricious in comparison with regular automatic rifles.
W special spray coating reduces the strain powder gases put on the internal mechanics and increases muzzle velocity at the same time.
Application of a special spray to internal parts
A long pull trigger group allows fully automatic fire from a sniper rifle.
A special stop stopping drive increases firearm accuracy.
By replacing the standard barrel with a longer one, the accuracy and muzzle velocity of the bullet was increased.
Without massive gas blowback systems and the rigid mounting stem, the accuracy is much greater.
A more efficient ventilation system allows the weapon to work faster.
Replacing the obsolete muzzle compensator with a more modern model helps further reduce recoil.
Installing a barrel with additional rifling increases the velocity and accuracy of the weapons.
Reducing the amount of rifling cut into the weapon increases the rate of fire, but on the other hand, the weapon won't be as useful for target shooting.
Polygonal rifling improves the accuracy of the weapon.
Sinusoidal rifling improves barrel cooling, increasing the rate of fire.
A carefully manufactured, custom made barrel increases accuracy.
Super strong materials increase rifling durability.
Internal cavities of the weapon have been modified, increasing resistance to wear.
A synthetic seal in the receiver leads to a marked increase in accuracy.
By replacing the standard barrel with a longer one muzzle velocity has increased.
Longitudinal venting lines cut into the barrel improve the weapon's cooling and reduce recoil.
By replacing the standard barrel with a longer one, muzzle velocity has increased.
A special spray protects the barrel from overheating, smooths out small factory defects and significantly increases the lifetime of the barrel.
A receiver balancer consists of several mobile elements, stabilizing the weapon when firing.
A rifled barrel precludes firing buckshot, but this is offset by a much higher accuracy.
Polymer seals help increase the pressure inside the barrel, increasing muzzle velocity.
Cylindrical bores help increase the rate of fire without compromising accuracy.
An active counterbalance shifts towards the muzzle of the barrel when firing and reduces the recoil.
By replacing the standard barrel with a longer one, growing flat trajectory bullets.
This modification of the frame can reduce recoil: overflow gas exits the barrel through special openings.
A shorter barrel with a more sophisticated design allows to increase the rate of fire without losing accuracy.
Chromium helps improve durability of the barrel of the weapon.
Separators assume part of the impact.
Simplified, shallow rifling can increase the rate of fire, which is important in close quarters combat with the enemy.
gun with additional rifling can increase velocity and battlefield accuracy.
Additional channels cut in the gun
Muzzle compensator with a flash suppressor
Sinusoidal rifling can improve its cooling and increase the rate without losing the muzzle velocity tractors flying bullets.
Polygonal rifling of the barrel is best suited for sniper rifles, as it improve muzzle velocity.
A pneumatic mechanism can alter the barrel's mechanism, increasing muzzle velocity.
Amplified servomotors increase the exoskeleton's load bearing capacity.
Design pioneered by Freedom's engineers, in order to reduce the weight of their first exoskeletons. Carbon fibre parts are just as durable as metal ones.
Replacement of metal parts with carbon fibre
Reinforcing parts of the exoskeleton protects it from destruction by bullets and shrapnel.
This system uses powerful springs and hinges, reducing the stress and allowing the wearer to conserve a lot of strength when moving.
Hydraulic amplifiers which allow you to switch to running mode are the main difference between the fourth and third generations of exoskeletons.
This thick textile lining helps prevent damage to soft tissues of the body after a direct hit by a bullet or piece of shrapnel.
Silicone sealants are more efficient than rubber at dampening shocks and protecting the carrier.
To reduce the weight of the armour, fasteners and gaskets are replaced with ones made of lighter synthetic materials.
Rubber helps to avoid damage to soft tissues of the body when hit by bullets or shrapnel.
This lining will protect the body in the event that the main suit becomes ruptured.
A mix of polycarbonate, silicone and carbon fibre - in case the main armour cracks.
Sealed protective suit created by Freedom, which is designed for artifact search and collection in areas of abnormal activity.
An airtight layer of synthetic materials helps in the event of damage to the outer layer.
An ergonomic rubber padding increases mobility in bulky armour.
Constantan does not conduct electricity and melts only at very high temperatures.
Lead provides reliable protection from radiation, because it absorbs all types of radiation particles.
Simple protection from rain and caustic substances.
Fabric of the costume was treated with a special mixture, protecting it from fire. This modification is especially popular among stalkers who hunt for fire artifacts.
Magnesium inserts protect from extremely high temperatures.
Dense polyethylene lining protects from poisonous substances and electrical shock.
To reduce the weight of the armour, fasteners and gaskets are made of lighter synthetic materials.
Replacement of textile costume details with synthetic
Plexiglas absorbs only two types of radioactive particles, but it is much lighter than lead.
Reliable protection from radioactive materials and electrical discharges.
Even a thin layer of constantan in the suit will provide excellent insulation from electric current.
Fibreglass is widely used by Ukrainian Ministry of Emergency workers in their equipment.
Impregnated fabric prevents the poisoning of the body with harmful chemicals.
Rubber provides basic protection from short-term radiation exposure.
Durable skid plates provide additional protection from bullets.
Nickel is a refracting metal that can be used to protect the body from fire.
An alloy of nickel and magnesium was used for this flak jacket, to protect the wearer from electric shock.
Insulating protective suit with manganin inserts
A sealed protective suit with corrosion-resistant coating and Kevlar armour plating.
A protective suit, created from next generation polymers, with bismuth inserts.
A lead frame forms a completely enclosed protective layer, shielding from radiation and hazardous substances, without restricting the mobility of the owner.
"Rescuer" plexiglas overalls with a flexible lead frame
A domestic development which appeared after the Chernobyl accident. Used in the exoskeleton to protect the electronics.
Installing an assault sight for close quarters combat.
A scope for combat on medium and long distances.
A scope making long range combat easier.
A scope making long range combat easier.
A modification of a standard red-dot sight, increasing contrast of the image with a yellow overlay. Makes fighting in darkness or low light conditions that much easier.
A thermal imager allows you to detect and locate sources of heat with characteristics similar to the human body.
Installing a night vision device will help you save your life - or take away someone else's.
This modification allows the shooter to freely adjust the scope magnification.
A pneumatic compensator offsets the recoil of automatic firing.
A cushioned shoulder stop significantly reduces the recoil.
A progressive butt, which takes into account the structural features of the human body.
When firing, the propellant gas is discharged from the barrel into the cavity behind the slide, ensuring smooth rollback.
An elongated bolt with a partially removed rear helps improve the muzzle velocity, which positively affects accuracy.
Increasing the length of the rollback bolt
Installing a mobile component in the stock reduces recoil.
Increased iron sights allow the Shooter to hit the target more accurately.
A spring with damping elements helps to improve the muzzle velocity of the weapon.
Located in the stock, a gas dampener recoil bolt group largely reduces the recoil.
A rubber butt-cap was initially installed only in large-calibre sniper rifles.
Adjustable stock, which can help the shooter to hit the target from any position, comfortable or not.
Located in the stock, this part absorbs the powerful recoil of large-calibre weapons.
Active filters can neutralize even the most corrosive chemicals.
It is well known that a closed steel hoop can partially protect from psi-radiation.
This mask is used in conditions of high air pollution or extreme temperatures.
A filter with a reinforced anti-corrosion coating and an additional safety layer protects the user from hazardous substances.
A plexiglas mask can partially protect against radiation.
A plexiglas mask can partially protect against radiation.
Insulating the respirator allows the carrier to avoid inhaling hazardous substances.
A beryllium-aluminium matrix, despite its low weight, provides the wearer with excellent protection.
A beryllium-titanium matrix provides the most effective protection without increase the weight of the helmet.
These filters are designed for scientists, giving them the ability to withstand any degree of pollution of the environment by maximizing the flow of oxygen to the lungs.
High-tech psi-protection, invented by a scientist named Sakharov.
A protective frame made of constantan allows the wearer to survive thermal and electrical anomalies.
Additional reinforcement increases the safety margin.
A system with reinforced filters and neutralizing segments, that prevents hazardous substances from contaminating the organism.
A night vision device which allows you to operate at night or in low light conditions.
This system automatically switches to a filtered breathing mode, in case hazardous air pollution by radioactive or poisonous substances is detected.
A better night vision device, designed for operations in complete darkness.
A thermal imager allows you to detect and lock on to sources of heat with a human signature.
A wave device, designed to work in areas with high levels of psionic radiation.
A better night vision device, designed for operations in complete darkness.
By extracting ions from air molecules, a so-called ionic wind can be created, which cools the wearer.
The infra-red scanner allows you to locate humans in your immediate vicinity, even in complete darkness.
"SPB - VPZ.m.IV" - "Mental Shielding System - Psi-Radiation Protection Mark Four".
Reinforced springs increase the muzzle velocity.
Installing seals on the moving parts of machinery will help to maximally stabilize the barrel when firing.
Installing additional springs with a reverse spiral can reduce the recoil without affecting bullet trajectory.
A protective coating increases the reliability, and most importantly, further isolates the receiver from the environment.
Titanium springs are much more efficient than steel ones.
Polymer parts which rigidly fix spring trajectory, reducing the sway.
Sealing couplings help increase the pressure in the barrel and the muzzle velocity.
The lock's speed is amplified through the use of powder gases and a modified closing mechanism, significantly increasing the rate of fire.
A replacement of the basic return mechanism with a more powerful one, with two guiding rods and return springs, which grants an increase in the rate of fire.
Special channels and outputs for the powder gases, located in the drum, help reduce recoil.
Adding skew shaped groves to the drum's rotation mechanism increases the fire rate, increasing the efficiency of powder gas use.
Replacing the base frame with a polymer one can reduce the mass of the weapon without compromising its reliability.
A receiver made from super alloys allows the weapon to withstand daily combat stress without compromising reliability.
An enhancement mounted on the front of the receiver that reduces recoil.
Installation of this shroud can increase the weapon's rate of fire overheating the barrel.
A more convenient shape of the grip makes handling the weapon more comfortable, especially when firing on the move.
A modification of the bull-pup receiver that makes its maintenance easier.
The spray smooths out minor flaws in weapon mechanics, significantly increasing muzzle velocity.
A stabilizer is installed inside the hollow grip, reducing recoil.
A hollow space inside the grip allows you to reduce the weapon's mass.
A lightened version of the stock.
A polymer frame helps reduce the overall mass of weapons.
Adding several balancing parts, which reduce recoil.
An ergonomic grip makes the firearm noticeably more comfortable.
A padded grip helps reduce recoil.
A more ergonomic stock simplifies weapon handling.
A special coating protects the weapon from the damaging effects of the environment.
Located in the butt of the weapon, a "Mercury" compensator absorbs part of the recoil when shooting.
Pulsating counterbalance is a weapon that moves in the opposite direction to the slide, compensating recoil.
Altering the weapon's material reduces uneven heating, improving the rate of fire.
A modification which shields the user from weapon heating.
A modification which requires great skill of the technician. Evenly distributes excess heat over the weapon frame.
Changing the base weapon layout to a more modern one significantly increases its accuracy.
An almost indestructible receiver allows the weapon to serve much longer.
More robust when compared to the composite structure.
Changing the basic framework for a lighter one, but no less firm.
A more comfortable grip simplifies handling of weapons.
A padded grip makes the recoil less tangible.
Protective curtain-seals shield the weapon from dirt and fall damage.
A more ergonomically shaped grip with a modified rear.
The size and shape of the grip can be adjusted under the owner's hand weapons.
A modification of the return spring (for the spring located in the grip).
A special grip shape, optimized with a mobile back plate.
This barrel shroud protects the weapon from wear.
A more thought out compensator, increasing performance to match even the highest quality weapons.
Improved design for the barrel of sniper fire at the limiting distance.
Installing heavy barrel with polygonal rifling
Longitudinal grooves inside the barrel prevent it from clogging and overheating.
An integrated silencer with a flash suppressor is essential for not giving away your position.
Sinusoidal rifling can increase the rate of fire, which is especially important for the assault weapons.

A first generation injector, developed by one of Kiev's institutes, periodically injects small doses of adrenaline into the bloodstream. On one hand, it's dangerous for the organism, but on another, it can save lives, improving reaction times dramatically.
A special filter condenses and removes poisonous substances through the purifying filter.
A short wave emitter - invention of the Clear Sky scientific group - increases blood clotting in open wounds.
This system temporarily electrifies the surface of the suit, to repulse radioactive and chemical particles.
This Beta generation injector acts when it detects a sudden drop in blood pressure. I injects miniature does of blood clotting agents into the bloodstream, to speed up wound closure.
By maintaining an optimal body temperature, this system allows to avoid fatigue.
A wave generator that noticeably increases wound regeneration and increases immunity levels and pain thresholds.
A wave device, designed to work in anomalous areas with high levels of psi-radiation.
This injector floods the bloodstream with a military cocktail of complex chemicals, which accelerate tissue regeneration and block pain.
A comprehensive system that monitors vital signs and injects vitamins, epinephrine or anabolics when needed.
While the principles of the psi-radiation remain unknown, this device helps reduce its ill effects. It's distinguishing feature is the calming effect it has on the nervous system.
Adding this part can partially offset recoil, increasing accuracy when firing full auto.
This is one of the simplest and most common modifications that reduce the inertia of the trigger.
Individually selecting composite parts for each weapon model is tedious and expensive, but the weapon's lifespan increases noticeably.
This modification can increase the rate of fire.
An automatically retracted spring helps you take the first shot faster.
A protective coating eliminates the possibility of misfiring due to failure in the trigger group.
Axle-free trigger helps to increase machinery automation rate, resulting in a markedly increased rate of fire.
This rotary system is well balanced, breaking smoothly, resulting in increased battlefield accuracy.
The trigger is automatically cocking the weapon, increasing accuracy.
One of the simplest and most common modifications of the trigger that reduce its inertia.
Preliminary partial cocked helps to increase the accuracy of battlefield weapons.
This modification smooths out trigger functioning, increasing accuracy.
modification, aimed at preventing weapons from the breakdown of the slide.
Modular firing mechanism ensures easy maintenance and replacement parts, as well as greater convenience in the use of arms.
An auxiliary chamber to the main blowback device reduces the amount of force needed to move the slide, increasing accuracy.
next step to maximize ergonomic and easy to use weapons: rapid change mode trigger group.
After the first shot is fired, all subsequent shots need the trigger to be pressed just halfway through.
Amplified servomotors increase the maximum load.
This system is designed to prevent tetanus, inflammation and provide disinfectants.
"Breathing" overalls with an integrated safety filter, providing you with a degree of safety in polluted environments.
An ergonomic improvement - this special attachment for a protective suit will help you evenly distribute your load.
Without oxygen cylinders, you can't survive for long in a polluted atmosphere, whether radioactive or chemical.
Installation of an additional container for artifacts.
This mounting system allows you to evenly distribute the load over the entire body.
A dorsal weight distribution frame reduces shoulder fatigue by evenly distributing encumbrance over the entire body, allowing you to pack in more weapons, supplies and equipment.
A simple module for decontamination, tetanus prevention and stimulant injection. It is rather primitive, but doesn't leave lasting lacerations from its injections.
A system with a built-in steel grill, that automatically adjusts its charge to that of the anomaly, reducing its threat to the wearer.
An experimental sprint module, in low demand across the Zone only due to its cost.
This system neutralizes poisonous substances inhaled into the respirator filters.
Installation of additional containers for artifacts.
A combat support system built into the suit is a rare sight on the battlefield, usually limited just to special forces. This system provides adrenaline and blood coagulant injections.
A prototype soldier support system. Designers decided to switch from adrenaline injection to cocktails of military agents, which accelerate wound regeneration.
This modification is not cheap, but it is certainly a future standard for next generation weapons.
Sealing the bolt prevents the loss of propellant gases, increasing muzzle velocity.
Despite its name, it replaces the regular bolt with an exposed bolt system: it should provide a higher rate of fire.
A gas bleeder with a shifting unit dissipates part of the recoil, which increases accuracy.
A second gas piston affects the slide mechanism, compensating for the recoil, which has a positive effect on accuracy.
A protective coating increases the tightness of the receiver box, which positively affects reliability.
Adding oblique grooves to the frame of the weapon helps reduce friction of moving parts and protects them from dirt, increasing weapon reliability.
Reducing the diameter of the gas chamber with synthetic sealants significantly increases the muzzle velocity.
A slide that directs the flow of air through the rifling to cool the weapon.
This slide slides along the stem, preventing the muzzle from climbing when firing.
With the installation of a gas piston, gases cease to go back directly into the receiver, which noticeably reduces weapon wear.
In this system of gas retained barrier-mechanism to expedite the movement of the latter.
Optimizing the gas piston increases the rate of fire.
A roller locking system increases accuracy.
New vents absorb some of the heat from the barrel, helping to avoid overheating during sustained combat.
Over the course of a long stroke, the gas piston slightly increases the overall length of the weapon, but has a positive effect on the muzzle velocity of the bullet trajectory.
Long course of the gas piston
A special mobile buffer evenly distributes recoil over the entire weapon, increasing accuracy.
A symmetrical, forced cooling system for the barrel, passing through the ejector, protects the weapon from overheating.
A new slide segment provides increased rate of fire, without overloading other parts of the weapon.
A new locking system, through a more efficient use of energy of powder gases, enhances the muzzle velocity of the bullet trajectory.
The new system reduces recoil, slowing down the rollback and return.
A special spray protects weapon parts from wear.
A new locking system with a more complete transfer of energy of powder gases enhances the muzzle velocity of the bullet trajectory.
A bigger internal slide protects the bolt of the gun from breakages.
A small polymer buffer distributes a part of the recoil.
A steel liner with spiral grooves helps reduce recoil.
Extending the course of the slide and strengthening the retracting mechanism, makes it possible to positively affect bullet trajectory.
A short course slide allows you to increase the rate of fire without negatively affecting bullet trajectory.
Using a stroke slide helps reach higher initial bullet velocities.
An optimized design of the gas piston allows for greater accuracy.
Installing a single relapsing module with two springs markedly increases accuracy without loss of performance.
Additional compensation holes made in the barrel can markedly reduce recoil.
When reassembled and retuned, the weapon can fire full auto..
Revamped internal mechanics allow for three round burst mode.
Do you really want to install:
Weapon's internal mechanics are unknown, it cannot be repaired without schematics.
The technician does not make such a modification
This part has already been modified
Technician need tools for rough work
Technician need tools for fine work
